title: Trump Leans Into Showmanship on Day 1 of His Asia Trip
summary: President Trump presided over several deals during his first day of a nearly weeklong trip. Buried in the details are Washington’s plans to contain China.

title: The ‘Sleeper Issue’ at the Heart of Trump’s Trade War on China
summary: Concern is increasing throughout Southeast Asia as U.S. officials, intent on slowing China, have yet to say how they will define the origin country of imports.

title: Trump and Xi Could ‘Consummate’ TikTok Deal This Week, Bessent Says
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on “Face the Nation” on Sunday that China and the United States had reached “a final deal on TikTok,” but offered few details.

title: Suspects in Louvre Jewelry Heist Arrested, French Authorities Say
summary: Thieves stole over $100 million in jewelry from the Paris museum. It is unclear how many people were arrested, but one man was caught while trying to leave France.

title: A Break-In That Shook France
summary: The robbery at the Louvre left behind more than broken glass. It battered the pride of a nation that is increasingly glum about itself and its direction.

title: German Company Launches Ad After Its Lift Is Used in Louvre Heist
summary: The brazen daylight robbery of the Louvre has turned into a marketing opportunity for Böcker, a German maker of cranes and elevators whose product was used in the heist.

title: ‘No Idea How Long People Can Hold Out’: Federal Workers Feel Brunt of Shutdown
summary: As more than one million government employees go without pay, many are turning to side jobs and food banks to make ends meet.

title: In Trump-Friendly Iowa, the President’s Policies Have Hit Hard
summary: The state has become a stronghold for President Trump. Now, his efforts on trade, energy and immigration are squeezing farmers, disrupting labor and threatening industries.

title: Under Trump, Voice of America Is Down but Not Out
summary: Buttressed by courts and support from some Republican lawmakers, federally funded newsrooms that President Trump has tried to eliminate have yet to be rendered obsolete.

title: Newsom Says He Will Consider a 2028 Presidential Run After the Midterms
summary: The California governor acknowledged in an interview Sunday on CBS that he would give the question serious thought after the 2026 elections.

title: As the Left’s Biggest Stars Unite Behind Mamdani, a Bigger Test Awaits
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders and Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will join Zohran Mamdani on Sunday to help push his bid to win the Nov. 4 election for mayor of New York City.

title: Can Cuomo Sway Trump Voters Away From Sliwa in the NYC Mayor’s Race?
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, a Democrat running on a third-party line, has appeared repeatedly on Staten Island and shifted his messaging in ways that seem designed to court Republican voters.

title: Is That Pumpkin Seaworthy? No Promises.
summary: In Maine, a pumpkin regatta is fighting dry summers and rising costs. (Its boats are mostly fighting to stay afloat.)

title: The Thread Tying Together Everything Trump Does
summary: Whether he is negotiating a deal in the Middle East, bombing boats off the coast of Venezuela or deploying troops to American cities, it’s always about power.

title: Labubus Ate My Daughter
summary: I thought our frenzied quest to find the trendy doll would teach my daughter a lesson. It did, just not the one I expected.

title: Halloween Season Is Here. Bring on the Horror.
summary: Why are scary movies doing so well right now?

title: How Maduro Is Responding to Trump’s Pressure on Venezuela’s Economy
summary: President Nicolás Maduro’s opponents hope a new period of economic pain will finally topple his government. He is using cryptocurrency to hold on.

title: Alvin Bragg, Seeking Re-election, Is Not Mentioning His Best-Known Case
summary: He is the only prosecutor to convict a president. But mentioning Donald Trump to him on the campaign trail is a conversation stopper.
